newsitem.title: EGYPT: Arab foreign ministers to have emergency meeting.
newsitem.headline: Arab foreign ministers to have emergency meeting.

text.p: Arab foreign ministers will have an emergency meeting on September 13 to take a united stand on recent developments in Arab-Israeli relations, Egypt's delegate to the Arab League said on Wednesday.
Last week Egypt asked the Arab League to call such a meeting to discuss the stalled peace process.
Palestinian President Yasser Arafat has also called for an emergency meeting of foreign ministers to implement resolutions adopted in the Cairo summit in June.
The summit told Israel that Arab states might reconsider steps towards peace with Israel if it does not fulfil its agreements or tries to change the basis for talks.
The League has brought forward a regular six-monthly ministerial meeting to September 14 and 15. The regular meetings usually start a week later.
"They will review developments in the peace process and resolutions taken on the stalled peace process in the Middle East," Mahmoud Mortada, Egypt's delegate, said.
The Arab League secretariat is still contacting member states on the Palestinian proposal, Mortada added.
The ministerial meeting would also be an opportunity for Egypt to sound out Arab opinion on plans to hold a Middle East economic summit in Cairo in November.
Egypt has said the economic conference will be pointless if Israel does not ensure progress towards Middle East peace.
